Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 773 Filed 08/10/22 Page 8 of 29 3125 LCRVMAXT

Anything else, counsel?
MS. MODE: No, your Honor. Thank you.
MR. EVERDELL: No, your Honor.
THE COURT: Thank you.
(Recess pending verdict)
THE COURT: I have a note.
May we please have the transcript of David Rodgers.
MS. MODE: Yes, your Honor. We'll take care of that right away.
THE COURT: Other issues to raise?
MS. MODE: Not from the government, your Honor.
Thank you.
MR. EVERDELL: Not from the defense.
THE COURT: We don't know what time the jury wishes to deliberate to this evening. My inclination would be to -- it's up to them when they wish to stop, so I assume we'll get a note. So I think we'll wait for that. But I am inclined to think about, if they are not done, extending deliberations tomorrow for at least some amount of time. But I'll hear from you on that. So you can think about it or respond to it now, Ms. Sternheim.
MS. STERNHEIM: I would just say that I think the jury should basically set its own schedule. You can suggest if they want a longer day, but I don't think we should be pushing them. They seem to be working very studiously and they seem to have a

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00017312
